Verse: ततः कोपं चकारोच्चैरम्बिका तानरीन्प्रति । कोपेन चास्या वदनं मषीवर्णमभूत्तदा॥
Translation: Ambikā cried out angrily against those foes, and In Wrath Her Face Turned As Black As Ink.

Verse: भ्रुकुटीकुटिलात्तस्या ललाटफलकाद्द्रुतम् । काली करालवदना विनिष्क्रान्तासिपाशिनी॥
Translation: From Her Scowling Brow, Kālī Sprang Forth, Frightful Of Countenance And Armed With Sword And Noose,

Verse: विचित्रखट्वाङ्गधरा नरमालाविभूषणा । द्वीपिचर्मपरीधाना शुष्कमांसातिभैरवा॥
Translation: Bearing A Strange Skull-Topped Staff, Adorned With A Garland Of Skulls, And Clad In A Tiger’s Skin. Her Emaciated Flesh Appalling,

Verse: अतिविस्तारवदना जिह्वाललनभीषणा । निमग्नारक्तनयना नादापूरितदिङ्मुखा॥
Translation: Her Mouth Gaping, Her Lolling Tongue Horrifying, Her Sunken Eyes Glowing red, She Filled the four quarters of the sky With Her Roars.

Verse: सा वेगेनाभिपतिता घातयन्ती महासुरान् । सैन्ये तत्र सुरारीणामभक्षयत तद्बलम्॥
Translation: Swiftly Falling Upon the great asuras in that army, She Slew And Devoured Those hosts of the Gods’ foes.

Verse: पार्ष्णिग्राहाङ्कुशग्राहयोधघण्टासमन्वितान् । समादायैकहस्तेन मुखे चिक्षेप वारणान्॥
Translation: Attacking the rear guard and Seizing the elephants with their drivers, warriors, and bells, She Flung them Into Her Mouth With A Single Hand.

Verse: तथैव योधं तुरगै रथं सारथिना सह । निक्षिप्य वक्त्रे दशनैश्चर्वयन्त्यतिभैरवम्॥
Translation: In like Manner, She Tossed the cavalry with its horses and the charioteers with their chariots Into Her Mouth and Ground them Furiously Between Her Teeth.

Verse: एकं जग्राह केशेषु ग्रीवायामथ चापरम् । पादेनाक्रम्य चैवान्यमुरसान्यमपोथयत्॥
Translation: She Seized one asura by the hair and another by the throat. Crushing another Underfoot, She Slammed yet another Against Her breast.

Verse: तैर्मुक्तानि च शस्त्राणि महास्त्राणि तथासुरैः । मुखेन जग्राह रुषा दशनैर्मथितान्यपि॥
Translation: The weapons and great missiles the asuras hurled She Caught In Her Mouth and Ground Angrily Between Her Teeth.

Verse: बलिनां तद्बलं सर्वमसुराणां दुरात्मनाम् । ममर्दाभक्षयच्चान्यानन्यांश्चाताडयत्तदा॥
Translation: All that army of mighty and evil-natured asuras She Ravaged, Devouring some and Beating others Severely.

Verse: असिना निहताः केचित्केचित्खट्वाङ्गताडिताः । जग्मुर्विनाशमसुरा दन्ताग्राभिहतास्तथा॥
Translation: She Struck Down some With Her Sword and Battered others with Her Skull-Topped Staff. Other asuras met their destruction Between Her Gnashing Teeth.

Verse: क्षणेन तद्बलं सर्वमसुराणां निपातितम् । दृष्ट्वा चण्डोऽभिदुद्राव तां कालीमतिभीषणाम्॥
Translation: When Caṇḍa saw the entire army of asuras swiftly struck down, he rushed at The Terrifying Kālī.

Verse: शरवर्षैर्महाभीमैर्भीमाक्षीं तां महासुरः । छादयामास चक्रैश्च मुण्डः क्षिप्तैः सहस्रशः॥
Translation: With a formidable deluge of arrows, that great asura engulfed The Glowering Kālī while Muṇḍa hurled discuses at Her by the thousands,

Verse: तानि चक्राण्यनेकानि विशमानानि तन्मुखम् । बभुर्यथार्कबिम्बानि सुबहूनि घनोदरम्॥
Translation: myriad discuses That Entered Her Mouth as so many solar orbs vanishing into the denseness of a cloud.

Verse: ततो जहासातिरुषा भीमं भैरवनादिनी । काली करालवदना दुर्दर्शदशनोज्ज्वला॥
Translation: With A Terrifying Roar, Kālī Laughed In Fury, Her Fearsome Teeth Gleaming Within Her Ghastly Mouth.

Verse: उत्थाय च महासिंहं देवी चण्डमधावत । गृहीत्वा चास्य केशेषु शिरस्तेनासिनाच्छिनत्॥
Translation: Mounting Her Great Lion, The Devī Rushed at Caṇḍa, seized him by the hair, and Severed his head With Her Sword.

Verse: अथ मुण्डोऽभ्यधावत्तां दृष्ट्वा चण्डं निपातितम् । तमप्यपातयद्भूमौ सा खड्गाभिहतं रुषा॥
Translation: Seeing Caṇḍa slain, Muṇḍa attacked Her. She Pushed him to the ground and Struck him In Fury With Her Sword.

Verse: हतशेषं ततः सैन्यं दृष्ट्वा चण्डं निपातितम् । मुण्डं च सुमहावीर्यं दिशो भेजे भयातुरम्॥
Translation: Seeing Caṇḍa and also the most valorous Muṇḍa slain, the remaining army panicked and fled in all directions.

Verse: शिरश्चण्डस्य काली च गृहीत्वा मुण्डमेव च । प्राह प्रचण्डाट्टहासमिश्रमभ्येत्य चण्डिकाम्॥
Translation: And Kālī, Grasping the heads of Caṇḍa and Muṇḍa, Approached Caṇḍikā. Mingling Fierce, Loud Laughter With Her Words, She Said:

Verse: मया तवात्रोपहृतौ चण्डमुण्डौ महापशू । युद्धयज्ञे स्वयं शुम्भं निशुम्भं च हनिष्यसि॥
Translation: ‘I Here Present To You Caṇḍa and Muṇḍa As Two Great Offerings in the sacrifice of battle. You Yourself Shall Slay Śumbha and Niśumbha.’”

Verse: ऋषिरुवाच॥
Translation: The seer said:

Verse: तावानीतौ ततो दृष्ट्वा चण्डमुण्डौ महासुरौ । उवाच कालीं कल्याणी ललितं चण्डिका वचः॥
Translation: “When She Saw Those two great asuras, Caṇḍa and Muṇḍa, Brought Before Her, The Auspicious Caṇḍikā Spoke These Playful Words To Kālī:

Verse: यस्माच्चण्डं च मुण्डं च गृहीत्वा त्वमुपागता । चामुण्डेति ततो लोके ख्याता देवी भविष्यसि॥
Translation: ‘Because You Have Overpowered Caṇḍa and Muṇḍa And Delivered Them To Me, You, O Devī, Will Henceforth Be Known In The World As Cāmuṇḍā.’”

Verse: ॐ ऋषिरुवाच॥
Translation: The seer said

Verse: चण्डे च निहते दैत्ये मुण्डे च विनिपातिते । बहुलेषु च सैन्येषु क्षयितेष्वसुरेश्वरः॥
Translation: “After Caṇḍa was killed, Muṇḍa slain, and the vast armies annihilated, the lord of asuras

Verse: ततः कोपपराधीनचेताः शुम्भः प्रतापवान् । उद्योगं सर्वसैन्यानां दैत्यानामादिदेश ह॥
Translation: burned with rage. His reason overcome, Śumbha ordered the marshaling of all the demon hosts:

Verse: अद्य सर्वबलैर्दैत्याः षडशीतिरुदायुधाः । कम्बूनां चतुरशीतिर्निर्यान्तु स्वबलैर्वृताः॥
Translation: ‘Now let the daitya clans with all their troops go forth, the eighty-six Udāyudha and the eighty-four Kambu families, together with their forces.

Verse: कोटिवीर्याणि पञ्चाशदसुराणां कुलानि वै । शतं कुलानि धौम्राणां निर्गच्छन्तु ममाज्ञया॥
Translation: Let the fifty Koṭivīrya families and the hundred Dhaumra clans depart at my command

Verse: कालका दौर्हृदा मौर्वाः कालिकेयास्तथासुराः । युद्धाय सज्जा निर्यान्तु आज्ञया त्वरिता मम॥
Translation: So also at my command, let the Kālaka, Daurhṛda, Maurya, and Kālakeya asuras set out in haste, armed for battle.’

Verse: इत्याज्ञाप्यासुरपतिः शुम्भो भैरवशासनः । निर्जगाम महासैन्यसहस्रैर्बहुभिर्वृतः॥
Translation: Having issued his orders, Śumbha, the despotic lord of asuras, went forth, attended by many thousands of mighty troops.

Verse: आयान्तं चण्डिका दृष्ट्वा तत्सैन्यमतिभीषणम् । ज्यास्वनैः पूरयामास धरणीगगनान्तरम्॥
Translation: Seeing that most formidable army approach, Caṇḍikā filled the space between earth and sky with the resonance of Her bowstring

Verse: ततः सिंहो महानादमतीव कृतवान्नृप । घण्टास्वनेन तान्नादानम्बिका चोपबृंहयत्॥
Translation: Thereupon her lion emitted a deafening roar, O king, and Ambikā heightened the noise with Her clanging bell.

Verse: धनुर्ज्यासिंहघण्टानां नादापूरितदिङ्मुखा । निनादैर्भीषणैः काली जिग्ये विस्तारितानना॥
Translation: Kālī drowned out the din of bowstring, lion, and bell, filling every direction with terrifying howls from Her gaping mouth.

Verse: तं निनादमुपश्रुत्य दैत्यसैन्यैश्चतुर्दिशम् । देवी सिंहस्तथा काली सरोषैः परिवारिताः॥
Translation: Hearing the tumult, the enraged demon armies closed in on the Devī, her lion, and Kālī from all four sides.

Verse: एतस्मिन्नन्तरे भूप विनाशाय सुरद्विषाम् । भवायामरसिंहानामतिवीर्यबलान्विताः॥
Translation: O king, at that very moment, to insure the well-being of the supreme gods and to annihilate their adversaries, surpassingly brave and powerful

Verse: ब्रह्मेशगुहविष्णूनां तथेन्द्रस्य च शक्तयः । शरीरेभ्यो विनिष्क्रम्य तद्रूपैश्चण्डिकां ययुः॥
Translation: śaktis, the gods’ embodied powers, sprang forth from the bodies of Brahmā, Śiva, Skanda, Viṣṇu, and Indra, mirroring the form of each. They approached Caṇḍikā.

Verse: यस्य देवस्य यद्रूपं यथा भूषणवाहनम् । तद्वदेव हि तच्छक्तिरसुरान्योद्धुमाययौ॥
Translation: Whatever that god’s form was, whatever his adornments and his mount, in that very form his śakti went forth to combat the asuras.

Verse: हंसयुक्तविमानाग्रे साक्षसूत्रकमण्डलुः । आयाता ब्रह्मणः शक्तिर्ब्रह्माणीत्यभिधीयते॥
Translation: In a celestial chariot drawn by swans, Brahmā’s śakti came forth with prayer beads and waterpot in hand. She is called Brahmāṇī.

Verse: माहेश्वरी वृषारूढा त्रिशूलवरधारिणी । महाहिवलया प्राप्ता चन्द्ररेखाविभूषणा॥
Translation: Māheśvarī arrived astride a bull, holding the finest trident, wearing great serpents for bracelets, and adorned with the crescent moon.

Verse: कौमारी शक्तिहस्ता च मयूरवरवाहना । योद्धुमभ्याययौ दैत्यानम्बिका गुहरूपिणी॥
Translation: Ambikā, having the war god’s form and riding a fine peacock, came forth as Kaumārī with spear in hand to fight against the daityas.

Verse: तथैव वैष्णवी शक्तिर्गरुडोपरि संस्थिता । शङ्खचक्रगदाशार्ङ्गखड्गहस्ताभ्युपाययौ॥
Translation: Likewise the śakti Vaiṣṇavī, mounted on Garuda, approached holding conch, discus, mace, bow, and sword.

Verse: यज्ञवाराहमतुलं रूपं या बिभ्रतो हरेः । शक्तिः साप्याययौ तत्र वाराहीं बिभ्रती तनुम्॥
Translation: The śakti of Hari, who bears the unique form of the sacrificial boar, came forward as Vārāhī in that boarlike aspect.

Verse: नारसिंही नृसिंहस्य बिभ्रती सदृशं वपुः । प्राप्ता तत्र सटाक्षेपक्षिप्तनक्षत्रसंहतिः॥
Translation: Nārasirhhī, resembling Viṣṇu’s embodiment as a man-lion, arrived there, scattering the constellations with the toss of Her mane.

Verse: वज्रहस्ता तथैवैन्द्री गजराजोपरि स्थिता । प्राप्ता सहस्रनयना यथा शक्रस्तथैव सा॥
Translation: Thousand-eyed like Indra, and in like manner with thunderbolt in hand, Aindrī arrived riding on the lord of elephants.

Verse: ततः परिवृतस्ताभिरीशानो देवशक्तिभिः । हन्यन्तामसुराः शीघ्रं मम प्रीत्याह चण्डिकाम्॥
Translation: Then Śiva, surrounded by those śaktis of the gods, said to Caṇḍikā, ‘Let the asuras quickly be slain for My satisfaction.’

Verse: ततो देवीशरीरात्तु विनिष्क्रान्तातिभीषणा । चण्डिका शक्तिरत्युग्रा शिवाशतनिनादिनी॥
Translation: Thereupon from the Devī’s body there issued forth Caṇḍikā’s Own terrifying śakti, savage in her fury and howling like a hundred jackals.

Verse: सा चाह धूम्रजटिलमीशानमपराजिता । दूत त्वं गच्छ भगवन् पार्श्वं शुम्भनिशुम्भयोः॥
Translation: And She, the unvanquished one, said to Śiva of dark, matted locks, ‘Go, My lord, as My messenger to Śumbha and Niśumbha.

Verse: ब्रूहि शुम्भं निशुम्भं च दानवावतिगर्वितौ । ये चान्ये दानवास्तत्र युद्धाय समुपस्थिताः॥
Translation: Say to those two arrogant dānavas, Śumbha and Niśumbha, and to the other dānavas assembled there for battle:

Verse: त्रैलोक्यमिन्द्रो लभतां देवाः सन्तु हविर्भुजः । यूयं प्रयात पातालं यदि जीवितुमिच्छथ॥
Translation: “Indra must regain the three worlds, the gods must again enjoy the sacrificial oblations, and you must return to the nether world if you wish to live.

Verse: बलावलेपादथ चेद्भवन्तो युद्धकाङ्क्षिणः । तदागच्छत तृप्यन्तु मच्छिवाः पिशितेन वः॥
Translation: But if through the conceit of strength you are desirous of battle, then come and let My jackals be satiated with your flesh!”’

Verse: यतो नियुक्तो दौत्येन तया देव्या शिवः स्वयम् । शिवदूतीति लोकेऽस्मिंस्ततः सा ख्यातिमागता॥
Translation: Since the Devī appointed Śiva himself as messenger, she has come to be known in this world as Śivadūtī.

Verse: तेऽपि श्रुत्वा वचो देव्याः शर्वाख्यातं महासुराः । अमर्षापूरिता जग्मुर्यत्र कात्यायनी स्थिता॥
Translation: Hearing Śiva declare the Devī’s words, the great asuras were filled with indignation and went to where Kātyāyanī stood.

Verse: ततः प्रथममेवाग्रे शरशक्त्यृष्टिवृष्टिभिः । ववर्षुरुद्धतामर्षास्तां देवीममरारयः॥
Translation: At the outbreak of battle, the gods’ adversaries, arrogant in their anger, rained torrents of arrows, spears, and lances upon the Devī.

Verse: सा च तान् प्रहितान् बाणाञ्छूलशक्तिपरश्वधान् । चिच्छेद लीलयाध्मातधनुर्मुक्तैर्महेषुभिः॥
Translation: And She, with great arrows shot from Her resounding bow, playfully split asunder their hurtling arrows, lances, spears, and axes.

Verse: तस्याग्रतस्तथा काली शूलपातविदारितान् । खट्वाङ्गपोथितांश्चारीन्कुर्वती व्यचरत्तदा॥
Translation: Kālī roamed about the battlefront, slashing Her enemies to shreds with Her spear and crushing them with Her skull-topped staff

Verse: कमण्डलुजलाक्षेपहतवीर्यान् हतौजसः । ब्रह्माणी चाकरोच्छत्रून्येन येन स्म धावति॥
Translation: And Brahmāṇī, wherever She went, left Her enemies sapped of strength, disabled by the holy water sprinkled from Her waterpot.

Verse: माहेश्वरी त्रिशूलेन तथा चक्रेण वैष्णवी । दैत्याञ्जघान कौमारी तथा शक्त्यातिकोपना॥
Translation: Māheśvarī slew the daityas with Her trident; so, too, did Vaiṣṇavī with Her discus, Kaumārī with Her spear, and the wrathful

Verse: ऐन्द्री कुलिशपातेन शतशो दैत्यदानवाः । पेतुर्विदारिताः पृथ्व्यां रुधिरौघप्रवर्षिणः॥
Translation: Aindrī with Her thunderbolt. Daityas and dānavas, tom asunder, fell by the hundreds, discharging torrents of blood upon the earth.

Verse: तुण्डप्रहारविध्वस्ता दंष्ट्राग्रक्षतवक्षसः । वाराहमूर्त्या न्यपतंश्चक्रेण च विदारिताः॥
Translation: They fell, scattered by blows from Vārāhī’s boarlike snout, pierced through the chest by Her tusks, and ripped apart by Her discus.

Verse: नखैर्विदारितांश्चान्यान् भक्षयन्ती महासुरान् । नारसिंही चचाराजौ नादापूर्णदिगम्बरा॥
Translation: Nārasiṁhī, tearing other great asuras apart with Her claws and devouring them, roamed about the battlefield, filling the sky with Her roars.

Verse: चण्डाट्टहासैरसुराः शिवदूत्यभिदूषिताः । पेतुः पृथिव्यां पतितांस्तांश्चखादाथ सा तदा॥
Translation: Dazed by Śivadūtī’s violent laughter, the asuras fell to the ground, and She devoured those fallen ones.

Verse: इति मातृगणं क्रुद्धं मर्दयन्तं महासुरान् । दृष्ट्वाभ्युपायैर्विविधैर्नेशुर्देवारिसैनिकाः॥
Translation: When the enemy troops saw the enraged band of Mothers crushing the mighty asuras by diverse means, they fled.

Verse: पलायनपरान्दृष्ट्वा दैत्यान्मातृगणार्दितान् । योद्धुमभ्याययौ क्रुद्धो रक्तबीजो महासुरः॥
Translation: Seeing the remaining daityas flee, tormented thus by the band of Mothers, the great asura Raktabīja went forth in anger to do battle.

Verse: रक्तबिन्दुर्यदा भूमौ पतत्यस्य शरीरतः । समुत्पतति मेदिन्यां तत्प्रमाणो महासुरः॥
Translation: Whenever a drop of blood fell from his body to the ground, an asura of like measure would rise up from the earth.

Verse: युयुधे स गदापाणिरिन्द्रशक्त्या महासुरः । ततश्चैन्द्री स्ववज्रेण रक्तबीजमताडयत्॥
Translation: With club in hand the great asura fought with Indra’s śakti. Then Aindrī struck Raktabīja with Her thunderbolt.

Verse: कुलिशेनाहतस्याशु बहु सुस्राव शोणितम् । समुत्तस्थुस्ततो योधास्तद्रूपास्तत्पराक्रमाः॥
Translation: Blood streamed in torrents from the stricken asura, and from that blood rose up warriors of identical form and might.

Verse: यावन्तः पतितास्तस्य शरीराद्रक्तबिन्दवः । तावन्तः पुरुषा जातास्तद्वीर्यबलविक्रमाः॥
Translation: As many drops of blood fell from his body, so many beings of equal valor, strength, and courage arose,

Verse: ते चापि युयुधुस्तत्र पुरुषा रक्तसम्भवाः । समं मातृभिरत्युग्रशस्त्रपातातिभीषणम्॥
Translation: and those who sprang up from his blood battled there with the Mothers ever more fiercely, hurling the most formidable of weapons.

Verse: पुनश्च वज्रपातेन क्षतमस्य शिरो यदा । ववाह रक्तं पुरुषास्ततो जाताः सहस्रशः॥
Translation: When the Devī’s thunderbolt struck Raktabīja’s head, blood flowed again, and from it asuras were born by the thousands

Verse: वैष्णवी समरे चैनं चक्रेणाभिजघान ह । गदया ताडयामास ऐन्द्री तमसुरेश्वरम्॥
Translation: In the combat Vaiṣṇavī attacked the lord of asuras with Her discus, and Aindri beat him with Her mace.

Verse: वैष्णवीचक्रभिन्नस्य रुधिरस्रावसम्भवैः । सहस्रशो जगद्व्याप्तं तत्प्रमाणैर्महासुरैः॥
Translation: Blood flowed from the cuts of Vaiṣṇavī’s discus, and there from great asuras of equal measure arose by the thousands and filled the world.

Verse: शक्त्या जघान कौमारी वाराही च तथासिना । माहेश्वरी त्रिशूलेन रक्तबीजं महासुरम्॥
Translation: Kaumārī with her spear, Vārāhī with her sword, and Māheśvarī with her trident struck the great asura Raktabīja,

Verse: स चापि गदया दैत्यः सर्वा एवाहनत् पृथक् । मातॄः कोपसमाविष्टो रक्तबीजो महासुरः॥
Translation: and he, the mighty, rage-filled daitya, struck all the Mothers one by one with his club.

Verse: तस्याहतस्य बहुधा शक्तिशूलादिभिर्भुवि । पपात यो वै रक्तौघस्तेनासञ्छतशोऽसुराः॥
Translation: Out of the blood that streamed upon the earth from the relentless wounds of spear, lance, and other weapons, asuras sprang up by the hundreds,

Verse: तैश्चासुरासृक्सम्भूतैरसुरैः सकलं जगत् । व्याप्तमासीत्ततो देवा भयमाजग्मुरुत्तमम्॥
Translation: and those demons born from this one demon’s flowing blood pervaded all the world. Utter terror seized the gods.

Verse: तान् विषण्णान् सुरान् दृष्ट्वा चण्डिका प्राहसत्वरम् । उवाच कालीं चामुण्डे विस्तीर्णं वदनं कुरु॥
Translation: Caṇḍikā burst into laughter at their despair and said to Kālī, ‘O Cāmuṇḍā, open wide your mouth

Verse: मच्छस्त्रपातसम्भूतान् रक्तबिन्दून् महासुरान् । रक्तबिन्दोः प्रतीच्छ त्वं वक्त्रेणानेन वेगिना॥
Translation: and quickly drink in the drops of blood from my weapons’ blows and the great asuras born therefrom.

Verse: भक्षयन्ती चर रणे तदुत्पन्नान्महासुरान् । एवमेष क्षयं दैत्यः क्षेणरक्तो गमिष्यति॥
Translation: Roam about on the battlefield and devour the great demons sprung from Raktabīja. So shall this daitya, drained of blood, go to his destruction.

Verse: भक्ष्यमाणास्त्वया चोग्रा न चोत्पत्स्यन्ति चापरे । इत्युक्त्वा तां ततो देवी शूलेनाभिजघान तम्॥
Translation: As you consume those fierce asuras, others shall not arise.’ Having spoken thus, the Devī attacked Raktabīja with her lance,

Verse: मुखेन काली जगृहे रक्तबीजस्य शोणितम् । ततोऽसावाजघानाथ गदया तत्र चण्डिकाम्॥
Translation: while Kālī avidly lapped up his blood. Raktabīja turned upon Caṇḍikā with his club,

Verse: न चास्या वेदनां चक्रे गदापातोऽल्पिकामपि । तस्याहतस्य देहात्तु बहु सुस्राव शोणितम्॥
Translation: but his cudgel blows caused Her not even the slightest pain. From his beaten body blood flowed copiously

Verse: यतस्ततस्तद्वक्त्रेण चामुण्डा सम्प्रतीच्छति । मुखे समुद्गता येऽस्या रक्तपातान्महासुराः॥
Translation: in every direction, and Cāmuṇḍā engulfed it with Her mouth. And within Her mouth those great asuras who sprang into being from the flow,

Verse: तांश्चखादाथ चामुण्डा पपौ तस्य च शोणितम् । देवी शूलेन वज्रेण बाणैरसिभिरृष्टिभिः॥
Translation: those She now devoured, even while drinking Raktabīja’s blood.

Verse: जघान रक्तबीजं तं चामुण्डापीतशोणितम् । स पपात महीपृष्ठे शस्त्रसङ्घसमाहतः॥
Translation: The Devī assailed Raktabīja with lance, thunderbolt, arrows, swords, and spears while Cāmuṇḍā drank his blood.

Verse: नीरक्तश्च महीपाल रक्तबीजो महासुरः । ततस्ते हर्षमतुलमवापुस्त्रिदशा नृप॥
Translation: O king, battered by that array of weapons and drained of blood, the great asura Raktabīja toppled to the ground.

Verse: तेषां मातृगणो जातो ननर्तासृङ्मदोद्धतः॥
Translation: The gods attained immeasurable joy, O king, and the band of Mothers born from them danced about, intoxicated with blood.”

Verse: ॐ राजोवाच॥
Translation: The king said:

Verse: विचित्रमिदमाख्यातं भगवन् भवता मम । देव्याश्चरितमाहात्म्यं रक्तबीजवधाश्रितम्॥
Translation: “Wonderful is this, revered sir, that you have told me about the Devī’s glorious deed in slaying Raktabīja.

Verse: भूयश्चेच्छाम्यहं श्रोतुं रक्तबीजे निपातिते । चकार शुम्भो यत्कर्म निशुम्भश्चातिकोपनः॥
Translation: I wish to hear more about what Śumbha and the wrathful Niśumbha did after Raktabīja was killed.”

Verse: ऋषिरुवाच॥
Translation: The seer said:

Verse: चकार कोपमतुलं रक्तबीजे निपातिते । शुम्भासुरो निशुम्भश्च हतेष्वन्येषु चाहवे॥
Translation: “After Raktabīja was killed and the others slain in battle, Śumbha and Niśumbha fell into unparalleled rage.

Verse: हन्यमानं महासैन्यं विलोक्यामर्षमुद्वहन् । अभ्यधावन्निशुम्भोऽथ मुख्ययासुरसेनया॥
Translation: Seeing that his mighty army was being slaughtered, Niśumba was overcome with fury and rushed forward with the best of his demon forces.

Verse: तस्याग्रतस्तथा पृष्ठे पार्श्वयोश्च महासुराः । सन्दष्टौष्ठपुटाः क्रुद्धा हन्तुं देवीमुपाययुः॥
Translation: In front of him, behind him, and on both sides, great asuras, their lips compressed in anger, advanced to slay the Devī.

Verse: आजगाम महावीर्यः शुम्भोऽपि स्वबलैर्वृतः । निहन्तुं चण्डिकां कोपात्कृत्वा युद्धं तु मातृभिः॥
Translation: Having battled the Mothers, Śumbha, mighty in valor and surrounded by his forces, came forward in fury to attack the Devī.

Verse: ततो युद्धमतीवासीद्देव्या शुम्भनिशुम्भयोः । शरवर्षमतीवोग्रं मेघयोरिव वर्षतोः॥
Translation: Fierce fighting erupted between them, and like two thunderclouds, Śumbha and Niśumbha rained down torrents of arrows on the Devī.

Verse: चिच्छेदास्ताञ्छरांस्ताभ्यां चण्डिका स्वशरोत्करैः । ताडयामास चाङ्गेषु शस्त्रौघैरसुरेश्वरौ॥
Translation: Caṇḍikā intercepted them with Her Own volley of arrows and struck the demon chiefs in the limbs with a stream of weapons.

Verse: निशुम्भो निशितं खड्गं चर्म चादाय सुप्रभम् । अताडयन्मूर्ध्नि सिंहं देव्या वाहनमुत्तमम्॥
Translation: Niśumbha, seizing his sharpened spear and shining shield, struck the lion, the Devī’s magnificent mount, on the head.

Verse: ताडिते वाहने देवी क्षुरप्रेणासिमुत्तमम् । निशुम्भस्याशु चिच्छेद चर्म चाप्यष्टचन्द्रकम्॥
Translation: Her lion assaulted, the Devī swiftly cut through Niśumbha’s superb sword with Her razor-sharp arrow and through his shield, emblazoned with eight moons.

Verse: छिन्ने चर्मणि खड्गे च शक्तिं चिक्षेप सोऽसुरः । तामप्यस्य द्विधा चक्रे चक्रेणाभिमुखागताम्॥
Translation: His shield and sword broken, the asura hurled his spear, and as it came toward Her, that, too, the Devī cut in half with Her discus.

Verse: कोपाध्मातो निशुम्भोऽथ शूलं जग्राह दानवः । आयातं मुष्टिपातेन देवी तच्चाप्यचूर्णयत्॥
Translation: Blustering with rage, the dānava Niśumbha seized his lance, and as it came flying, the Devī crushed it with a blow of Her fist.

Verse: आविद्याथ गदां सोऽपि चिक्षेप चण्डिकां प्रति । सापि देव्यास् त्रिशूलेन भिन्ना भस्मत्वमागता॥
Translation: Then swinging his club, Niśumbha flung it at Caṇḍikā. The Devī’s trident reduced it to ashes.

Verse: ततः परशुहस्तं तमायान्तं दैत्यपुङ्गवम् । आहत्य देवी बाणौघैरपातयत भूतले॥
Translation: After wounding the onrushing demon chief with ax in hand, the Devī forced him to the ground with a volley of arrows.

Verse: तस्मिन्निपतिते भूमौ निशुम्भे भीमविक्रमे । भ्रातर्यतीव सङ्क्रुद्धः प्रययौ हन्तुमम्बिकाम्॥
Translation: When he saw Niśumbha, his brother of fearsome strength, lying fallen on the ground, Śumbha moved forward, greatly enraged, to slay Ambikā.

Verse: स रथस्थस्तथात्युच्चैर्गृहीतपरमायुधैः । भुजैरष्टाभिरतुलैर्व्याप्याशेषं बभौ नभः॥
Translation: Standing in his chariot and holding aloft magnificent weapons, he shone forth and filled the entire sky with his eight incomparable arms

Verse: तमायान्तं समालोक्य देवी शङ्खमवादयत् । ज्याशब्दं चापि धनुषश्चकारातीव दुःसहम्॥
Translation: While She watched him approach, the Devī sounded Her conch, set off an unbearable reverberation with Her bowstring,

Verse: पूरयामास ककुभो निजघण्टास्वनेन च । समस्तदैत्यसैन्यानां तेजोवधविधायिना॥
Translation: and filled the firmament with the ringing of Her bell, which sapped the strength of the assembled demon armies.

Verse: ततः सिंहो महानादैस्त्याजितेभमहामदैः । पूरयामास गगनं गां तथैव दिशो दश॥
Translation: Then the lion filled every direction with great roars that caused even the elephants’ mighty prowess to falter.

Verse: ततः काली समुत्पत्य गगनं क्ष्मामताडयत् । कराभ्यां तन्निनादेन प्राक्स्वनास्ते तिरोहिताः॥
Translation: Kālī sprang skyward and alighted, pounding the earth with Her two hands. The noise drowned out all the previous sounds.

Verse: अट्टाट्टहासमशिवं शिवदूती चकार ह । वैः शब्दैरसुरास्त्रेसुः शुम्भः कोपं परं ययौ॥
Translation: Śivadūtī laughed loudly and menacingly. When the asuras grew terrified at the sounds, Śumbha flew into a monstrous rage.

Verse: दुरात्मंस्तिष्ठ तिष्ठेति व्याजहाराम्बिका यदा । तदा जयेत्यभिहितं देवैराकाशसंस्थितैः॥
Translation: Ambikā cried out for him, that evil-natured one, to stop, and the gods cheered Her on to victory from their positions in the sky.

Verse: शुम्भेनागत्य या शक्तिर्मुक्ता ज्वालातिभीषणा । आयान्ती वह्निकूटाभा सा निरस्ता महोल्कया॥
Translation: But Śumbha approached and hurled a fearsome, flaming spear, an oncoming mass of fire that the Devī’s own firebrand warded off.

Verse: सिंहनादेन शुम्भस्य व्याप्तं लोकत्रयान्तरम् । निर्घातनिःस्वनो घोरो जितवानवनीपते॥
Translation: Śumbha’s leonine roar pervaded the space between heaven, earth, and the netherworld, but the Devī’s violent thunderclap drowned it out, O king.

Verse: शुम्भमुक्ताञ्छरान्देवी शुम्भस्तत्प्रहिताञ्छरान् । चिच्छेद स्वशरैरुग्रैः शतशोऽथ सहस्रशः॥
Translation: The Devī split Śumbha’s flying arrows with sharp arrows of Her own, and likewise he split Hers, each discharging arrows by the hundreds and thousands.

Verse: ततः सा चण्डिका क्रुद्धा शूलेनाभिजघान तम् । स तदाभिहतो भूमौ मूर्च्छितो निपपात ह॥
Translation: Then the enraged Caṇḍikā pierced Śumbha with Her lance. Wounded, he fainted and fell to the ground.

Verse: ततो निशुम्भः सम्प्राप्य चेतनामात्तकार्मुकः । आजघान शरैर्देवीं कालीं केसरिणं तथा॥
Translation: Meanwhile Niśumbha, regaining consciousness, seized his bow and shot arrows at theDevī, Kālī, and the lion.

Verse: पुनश्च कृत्वा बाहूनामयुतं दनुजेश्वरः । चक्रायुधेन दितिजश्छादयामास चण्डिकाम्॥
Translation: And then, creating ten thousand arms for himself, the daitya chief, that son of Diti, engulfed Caṇḍikā with ten thousand discuses.

Verse: ततो भगवती क्रुद्धा दुर्गा दुर्गार्तिनाशिनी । चिच्छेद देवी चक्राणि स्वशरैः सायकांश्च तान्॥
Translation: Thus provoked, the glorious Durgā, who destroys adversity and afflictions, cut through his discuses and missiles with arrows of Her own.

Verse: ततो निशुम्भो वेगेन गदामादाय चण्डिकाम् । अभ्यधावत वै हन्तुं दैत्यसैन्यसमावृतः॥
Translation: Niśumbha, surrounded by his demon army, swiftly seized his club and rushed at Caṇḍikā to kill Her.

Verse: तस्यापतत एवाशु गदां चिच्छेद चण्डिका । खड्गेन शितधारेण स च शूलं समाददे॥
Translation: Instantly She split the onrushing Niśumbha’s club with Her keen-edged sword. He grasped his lance,

Verse: शूलहस्तं समायान्तं निशुम्भममरार्दनम् । हृदि विव्याध शूलेन वेगाविद्धेन चण्डिका॥
Translation: and as he approached with weapon in hand, Caṇḍikā pierced him, the afflictor of the gods, through the heart with a swiftly hurled spear.

Verse: भिन्नस्य तस्य शूलेन हृदयान्निःसृतोऽपरः । महाबलो महावीर्यस्तिष्ठेति पुरुषो वदन्॥
Translation: From his heart’s gaping wound came forth another mighty and valorous being, who shouted for the Devī to stop.

Verse: तस्य निष्क्रामतो देवी प्रहस्य स्वनवत्ततः । शिरश्चिच्छेद खड्गेन ततोऽसावपतद्भुवि॥
Translation: Bursting into derisive laughter, She severed his head with Her sword, and the figure who had thus emerged fell to the ground.

Verse: ततः सिंहश्चखादोग्रदंष्ट्राक्षुण्णशिरोधरान् । असुरांस्तांस्तथा काली शिवदूती तथापरान्॥
Translation: The lion then devoured the asuras whose necks it had crushed with its fearsome fangs, while Kālī and Śivadūtī devoured others.

Verse: कौमारीशक्तिनिर्भिन्नाः केचिन्नेशुर्महासुराः । ब्रह्माणीमन्त्रपूतेन तोयेनान्ये निराकृताः॥
Translation: Great asuras perished, pierced through by Kaumārī’s spear; others shrank away from the water sanctified by Brahmāṇī’s mantras.

Verse: माहेश्वरीत्रिशूलेन भिन्नाः पेतुस्तथापरे । वाराहीतुण्डघातेन केचिच्चूर्णीकृता भुवि॥
Translation: Others fell, ripped open by Māheśvarī’s trident; some lay on the ground, smashed by the blows of Vārāhī’s snout.

Verse: खण्डं खण्डं च चक्रेण वैष्णव्या दानवाः कृताः । वज्रेण चैन्द्रीहस्ताग्रविमुक्तेन तथापरे॥
Translation: Dānavas were cut to pieces, some by Vaiṣṇavī’s discus and others by the thunderbolt discharged from Aindrī’s fingertips.

Verse: केचिद्विनेशुरसुराः केचिन्नष्टा महाहवात् । भक्षिताश्चापरे कालीशिवदूतीमृगाधिपैः॥
Translation: Some asuras perished, some fled from the great battle, and others were devoured by Kālī, Śivadūtī, and the lion.”

Verse: ॐ ऋषिरुवाच॥
Translation: The seer said:

Verse: निशुम्भं निहतं दृष्ट्वा भ्रातरं प्राणसम्मितम् । हन्यमानं बलं चैव शुम्भः क्रुद्धोऽब्रवीद्वचः॥
Translation: “Seeing the lifeless body of Niśumbha, the brother who was as dear to him as life itself, and seeing his forces being slaughtered, the enraged Śumbha spoke these words:

Verse: बलावलेपदुष्टे त्वं मा दुर्गे गर्वमावह । अन्यासां बलमाश्रित्य युद्ध्यसे चातिमानिनी॥
Translation: ‘O Durgā, who are corrupt with the arrogance of power, do not show your pride here, for though you are haughty, you fight depending on the strength of others.’

Verse: देव्युवाच॥
Translation: The Devī said:

Verse: एकैवाहं जगत्यत्र द्वितीया का ममापरा । पश्यैता दुष्ट मय्येव विशन्त्यो मद्विभूतयः॥
Translation: ‘I Am Alone Here in the world. Who else is there besides Me? Behold, O vile one! These are but Projections of My Own Power, now Entering Back into Me.’

Verse: ततः समस्तास्ता देव्यो ब्रह्माणीप्रमुखा लयम् । तस्या देव्यास्तनौ जग्मुरेकैवासीत्तदाम्बिका॥
Translation: Thereupon All Those Goddesses, Led By Brahmāṇī, Merged Into The Devī’s Body. Then Ambikā Alone Remained.

Verse: देव्युवाच॥
Translation: The Devī Said:

Verse: अहं विभूत्या बहुभिरिह रूपैर्यदास्थिता । तत्संहृतं मयैकैव तिष्ठाम्याजौ स्थिरो भव॥
Translation: ‘I have Now Withdrawn the Many Forms I Inhabited Here, Projected by My power. I Stand Alone. Be resolute in combat.’”

Verse: ऋषिरुवाच॥
Translation: The seer said:

Verse: ततः प्रववृते युद्धं देव्याः शुम्भस्य चोभयोः । पश्यतां सर्वदेवानामसुराणां च दारुणम्॥
Translation: “Then a horrific battle broke out between the two of them, the Devī and Śumbha, while all the Gods and asuras looked on.

Verse: शरवर्षैः शितैः शस्त्रैस्तथा चास्त्रैः सुदारुणैः । तयोर्युद्धमभूद्भूयः सर्वलोकभयङ्करम्॥
Translation: With showers of arrows, sharp weapons, and terrifying missiles, the two met again in a combat that frightened all the world.

Verse: दिव्यान्यस्त्राणि शतशो मुमुचे यान्यथाम्बिका । बभञ्ज तानि दैत्येन्द्रस्तत्प्रतीघातकर्तृभिः॥
Translation: The Wondrous Weapons That Ambikā Now Unleashed by the hundreds, the daitya chief deflected with defensive strikes.

Verse: मुक्तानि तेन चास्त्राणि दिव्यानि परमेश्वरी । बभञ्ज लीलयैवोग्रहुङ्कारोच्चारणादिभिः॥
Translation: And the magic missiles that he hurled, the Supreme Devī Shattered Playfully With Fierce Cries of Contempt.

Verse: ततः शरशतैर्देवीमाच्छादयत सोऽसुरः । सापि तत्कुपिता देवी धनुश्चिच्छेद चेषुभिः॥
Translation: Then the asura covered Her with hundreds of arrows. Provoked, the Devī Discharged Her arrows and Split his bow.

Verse: छिन्ने धनुषि दैत्येन्द्रस्तथा शक्तिमथाददे । चिच्छेद देवी चक्रेण तामप्यस्य करे स्थिताम्॥
Translation: His bow broken, the daitya chief took up his spear, but even as it rested in his hand, the Devī Cut Through it With Her Discus.

Verse: ततः खड्गमुपादाय शतचन्द्रं च भानुमत् । अभ्यधा वत तां देवीं दैत्यानामधिपेश्वरः॥
Translation: Then, grasping his sword, emblazoned with a hundred moons, the supreme lord of the daityas rushed at the Devī.

Verse: तस्यापतत एवाशु खड्गं चिच्छेद चण्डिका । धनुर्मुक्तैः शितैर्बाणैश्चर्म चार्ककरामलम् । अश्वांश्च पातयामास रथं सारथिना सह॥
Translation: As he advanced, Caṇḍikā Broke his sword with sharp Arrows shot from Her bow, and also his shield that shone as the sun’s rays.

Verse: हताश्वः स तदा दैत्यश्छिन्नधन्वा विसारथिः । जग्राह मुद्गरं घोरमम्बिकानिधनोद्यतः॥
Translation: His steed slain, his bow broken, his chariot wrecked, the daitya grasped his fearsome mace, intent on destroying Ambikā.

Verse: चिच्छेदापततस्तस्य मुद्गरं निशितैः शरैः । तथापि सोऽभ्यधावत्तां मुष्टिमुद्यम्य वेगवान्॥
Translation: With sharp Arrows, She Shattered the onrushing Śumbha’s mace. Still, he rushed at Her with fist upraised.

Verse: स मुष्टिं पातयामास हृदये दैत्यपुङ्गवः । देव्यास्तं चापि सा देवी तलेनोरस्यताडयत्॥
Translation: The daitya chief slammed his fist down on the Devī’s Heart, and She Struck him on the chest with Her Palm.

Verse: तलप्रहाराभिहतो निपपात महीतले । स दैत्यराजः सहसा पुनरेव तथोत्थितः॥
Translation: Struck by that blow, the demon king fell to the ground. At once, he rose up again,

Verse: उत्पत्य च प्रगृह्योच्चैर्देवीं गगनमास्थितः । तत्रापि सा निराधारा युयुधे तेन चण्डिका॥
Translation: and springing upward, he seized the Devī and ascended high into the sky. There in midair Caṇḍikā Battled with him.

Verse: नियुद्धं खे तदा दैत्यश्चण्डिका च परस्परम् । चक्रतुः प्रथमं सिद्धमुनिविस्मयकारकम्॥
Translation: In the sky, the daitya and Caṇḍikā fought hand to hand as never before, to the astonishment of saints and sages.

Verse: ततो नियुद्धं सुचिरं कृत्वा तेनाम्बिका सह । उत्पाट्य भ्रामयामास चिक्षेप धरणीतले॥
Translation: And after prolonged combat, Ambikā Snatched him up, swung him around, and Flung him to the earth.

Verse: स क्षिप्तो धरणीं प्राप्य मुष्टिमुद्यम्य वेगवान् । अभ्यधावत दुष्टात्मा चण्डिकानिधनेच्छया॥
Translation: Striking the ground, the evil one immediately raised his fist and ran forward, desirous of destroying Ambikā.

Verse: तमायान्तं ततो देवी सर्वदैत्यजनेश्वरम् । जगत्यां पातयामास भित्त्वा शूलेन वक्षसि॥
Translation: The Devī thrust Her Spear through his chest and Threw that onrushing lord of all demonic creatures to the ground.

Verse: स गतासुः पपातोर्व्यां देवी शूलाग्रविक्षतः । चालयन् सकलां पृथ्वीं साब्धिद्वीपां सपर्वताम्॥
Translation: Pierced through by The Devī’s Weapon, his life-breath gone, he fell to the ground, shaking all the earth together with its oceans, islands, and mountains.

Verse: ततः प्रसन्नमखिलं हते तस्मिन् दुरात्मनि । जगत्स्वास्थ्यमतीवाप निर्मलं चाभवन्नभः॥
Translation: When the evil one was slain, all the universe became calm, regaining its natural order, and the sky cleared.

Verse: उत्पातमेघाः सोल्का ये प्रागासंस्ते शमं ययुः । सरितो मार्गवाहिन्यस्तथासंस्तत्र पातिते॥
Translation: The flaming clouds of portent that formerly gathered now subsided, and rivers again flowed along their courses when Śumbha fell slain.

Verse: ततो देवगणाः सर्वे हर्षनिर्भरमानसाः । बभूवुर्निहते तस्मिन् गन्धर्वा ललितं जगुः॥
Translation: All the hosts of Gods were overjoyed when he lay slain, and the celestial musicians sang sweetly.

Verse: अवादयंस्तथैवान्ये ननृतुश्चाप्सरोगणाः । ववुः पुण्यास्तथा वाताः सुप्रभोऽभूद्दिवाकरः॥
Translation: Others sounded their instruments, and throngs of heavenly nymphs danced. Favorable winds blew, and the sun shone in glory.

Verse: जज्वलुश्चाग्नयः शान्ताः शान्ता दिग्जनितस्वनाः॥
Translation: The sacred fires glowed peacefully, and the sounds born of the four directions faded away.”

Verse: ॐ ऋषिरुवाच॥
Translation: The seer said:

Verse: देव्या हते तत्र महासुरेन्द्रे सेन्द्राः सुरा वह्निपुरोगमास्ताम् । कात्यायनीं तुष्टुवुरिष्टलाभाद् विकाशिवक्त्राब्जविकाशिताशाः॥
Translation: “After the Devī had slain the great asura chief, Indra and the other gods, led by Agni, praised Kātyāyanī for granting their wishes. With hopes fulfilled, their faces beamed.

Verse: देवि प्रपन्नार्तिहरे प्रसीद प्रसीद मातर्जगतोऽखिलस्य । प्रसीद विश्वेश्वरि पाहि विश्वं त्वमीश्वरी देवि चराचरस्य॥
Translation: ‘O Devī, Who remove the sufferings of those who take refuge in you, be gracious. Be Gracious, Mother of the entire world. Be Gracious, Ruler of All. Protect the universe, O Devī, Who are the Ruler of the Moving and The Unmoving.

Verse: आधारभूता जगतस्त्वमेका महीस्वरूपेण यतः स्थितासि । अपां स्वरूपस्थितया त्वयैतदाप्यायते कृत्स्नमलङ्घ्यवीर्ये॥
Translation: You Alone Are The Sustaining Power Of The World, for You Abide In The Form Of The Earth. By You, Who Exist In The Form Of Water, all this universe prospers, O Devī Of Unsurpassable Strength.

Verse: त्वं वैष्णवीशक्तिरनन्तवीर्या विश्वस्य बीजं परमासि माया । सम्मोहितं देवि समस्तमेतत् त्वं वै प्रसन्ना भुवि मुक्तिहेतुः॥
Translation: Of Boundless Might, You Are Viṣṇu’s Power, The Source Of All, The Supreme Māyā. Deluded, O Devī, is all this universe. In this world, You Alone, When Pleased, Are The Cause Of Liberation.

Verse: विद्याः समस्तास्तव देवि भेदाः स्त्रियः समस्ताः सकला जगत्सु । त्वयैकया पूरितमम्बयैतत् का ते स्तुतिः स्तव्यपरापरोक्तिः॥
Translation: All Forms Of Knowledge Are Your Aspects, O Devī, as are All Women In The world. By You Alone, The Mother, Is This world filled. What praise can be sung to You Who Are Beyond Praise?

Verse: सर्वभूता यदा देवी भुक्तिमुक्तिप्रदायिनी । त्वं स्तुता स्तुतये का वा भवन्तु परमोक्तयः॥
Translation: O Devī, Who Have Become All Things, Who Bestow Enjoyment And Liberation—when You are praised, what Words, however excellent, can extol You?

Verse: सर्वस्य बुद्धिरूपेण जनस्य हृदि संस्थिते । स्वर्गापवर्गदे देवि नारायणि नमोऽस्तु ते॥
Translation: Salutation be To you, Devī Nārāyaṇī, Who Abide As Intelligence In The Hearts Of All Beings, Granting Heavenly Reward And Final Liberation.

Verse: कलाकाष्ठादिरूपेण परिणामप्रदायिनि । विश्वस्योपरतौ शक्ते नारायणि नमोऽस्तु ते॥
Translation: Salutation be To You, Nārāyaṇī, Who Bring Change As The Moments Of Ever-Passing Time, Who Are The Power At The Cessation of the universe.

Verse: सर्वमङ्गलमाङ्गल्ये शिवे सर्वार्थसाधिके । शरण्ये त्र्यम्बके गौरि नारायणि नमोऽस्तु ते॥
Translation: Salutation be To You, Nārāyaṇī, Who Are The Good Of All Good, The Auspicious One; To You Who Accomplish Every Intent; To You, The Refuge, The All-Knowing, Shining Gauri!

Verse: सृष्टिस्थितिविनाशानां शक्तिभूते सनातनि । गुणाश्रये गुणमये नारायणि नमोऽस्तु ते॥
Translation: Salutation be To You, Nārāyaṇī, Who Are The Power Of Creation, Sustenance, And Destruction; Who Are Eternal; Who Are The Source And Embodiment Of The Threefold Energy.

Verse: शरणागतदीनार्तपरित्राणपरायणे । सर्वस्यार्तिहरे देवि नारायणि नमोऽस्तु ते॥
Translation: Salutation be To You, Nārāyaṇī, Who Are Intent On Rescuing the distressed and afflicted that take refuge in You; to Tou, O Devī, Who Temove the suffering of all.

Verse: हंसयुक्तविमानस्थे ब्रह्माणीरूपधारिणि । कौशाम्भःक्षरिके देवि नारायणि नमोऽस्तु ते॥
Translation: Salutation be To You, Nārāyaṇī, Who Assume The Form Of Brahmāṇl, Riding In A Swanyoked Chariot, O Devī, And Sprinkling sanctified water.

Verse: त्रिशूलचन्द्राहिधरे महावृषभवाहिनि । माहेश्वरीस्वरूपेण नारायणि नमोऽस्तुते॥
Translation: Salutation be To You, Nārāyaṇī, Who Have The Form Of Māheśvarl, Bearing trident, moon, and serpent, and Riding a mighty bull.

Verse: मयूरकुक्कुटवृते महाशक्तिधरेऽनघे । कौमारीरूपसंस्थाने नारायणि नमोऽस्तु ते॥
Translation: Salutation be To You, Nārāyaṇī, Who Have The Form Of Kaumāri, The Faultless One attended by peacock and cock, and Bearing A Great Spear.

Verse: शङ्खचक्रगदाशार्ङ्गगृहीतपरमायुधे । प्रसीद वैष्णवीरूपे नारायणि नमोऽस्तु ते॥
Translation: Salutation be To you, Nārāyaṇī, Who Have The Form Of Vaisṇavl, Holding The Supreme Weapons of conch, discus, mace, and bow. Be Gracious!

Verse: गृहीतोग्रमहाचक्रे दंष्ट्रोद्धृतवसुन्धरे । वराहरूपिणि शिवे नारायणि नमोऽस्तु ते॥
Translation: Salutation be To You, Nārāyaṇī, Auspicious One, Who Have Viṣṇu’s Boarlike Form, Grasping A Great, Formidable Discus and Uplifting The Earth With Your tusks.

Verse: नृसिंहरूपेणोग्रेण हन्तुं दैत्यान् कृतोद्यमे । त्रैलोक्यत्राणसहिते नारायणि नमोऽस्तु ते॥
Translation: Salutation be To You, Nārāyanl, Who In The Ferocious Form Of The Man-Lion Are Intent On Killing the daityas and Protecting the three worlds.

Verse: किरीटिनि महावज्रे सहस्रनयनोज्ज्वले । वृत्रप्राणहरे चैन्द्रि नारायणि नमोऽस्तु ते॥
Translation: Salutation be To You, Nārāyaṇī, Who Are Adorned With Diadem, great thunderbolt, and Thousand-Eyed Radiance; to You, O Aindrī, Who Took the demon Vṛtra’s life-breath!

Verse: शिवदूतीस्वरूपेण हतदैत्यमहाबले । घोररूपे महारावे नारायणि नमोऽस्तु ते॥
Translation: Salutation be To You, Nārāyaṇī, Who In The Form Of Śivadūtī, Of Frightful Visage and Piercing Shrieks, Slew the mighty demon army.

Verse: दंष्ट्राकरालवदने शिरोमालाविभूषणे । चामुण्डे मुण्डमथने नारायणि नमोऽस्तु ते॥
Translation: Salutation be To You, Nārāyaṇī, Whose Mouth Bares Its Terrifying Teeth and Whose Neck Is Adorned With A Garland Of Skulls; To You, O Cāmuṇḍā, Destroyer of Muṇḍa!

Verse: लक्ष्मि लज्जे महाविद्ये श्रद्धे पुष्टि स्वधे ध्रुवे । महारात्रि महामाये नारायणि नमोऽस्तु ते॥
Translation: Salutation be To You, Nārāyaṇī, Who Are Good Fortune, Modesty, Great Knowledge, Faith, Prosperity, Satisfaction to the ancestral spirits, Constancy, The Great Night, and The Great Illusion.

Verse: मेधे सरस्वति वरे भूति बाभ्रवि तामसि । नियते त्वं प्रसीदेशे नारायणि नमोऽस्तुते॥
Translation: Salutation be To You, Nārāyaṇī, Most Excellent Sarasvatī, Who Are Intelligence and Well-Being, The Divine Consort and The Dark One, Ever Constant. Be gracious, O You Who Are Supreme!

Verse: सर्वस्वरूपे सर्वेशे सर्वशक्तिसमन्विते । भयेभ्यस्त्राहि नो देवि दुर्गे देवि नमोऽस्तु ते॥
Translation: O Devī, Who Exist In The Form Of All, Who Are The Ruler Of All, Possessing All Power, protect us from fears. O Devī Durgā, salutation be to You!

Verse: एतत्ते वदनं सौम्यं लोचनत्रयभूषितम् । पातु नः सर्वभूतेभ्यः कात्यायनि नमोऽस्तु ते॥
Translation: May This Gentle Face Of Yours, Adorned With Three Eyes, protect us in every way. O Kātyāyanī, salutation be to you!

Verse: ज्वालाकरालमत्युग्रमशेषासुरसूदनम् । त्रिशूलं पातु नो भीतेर्भद्रकालि नमोऽस्तु ते॥
Translation: May Your Terrible, Flaming Trident, Exceedingly Sharp and Destroying all asuras, protect us from dread. O Bhadrakālī, salutation be to You!

Verse: हिनस्ति दैत्यतेजांसि स्वनेनापूर्य या जगत् । सा घण्टा पातु नो देवि पापेभ्यो नः सुतानिव॥
Translation: May Your bell that destroys the daityas’ life-force and fills the world with its ringing protect us from all evils, O Devī, even As A Mother Protects her children.

Verse: असुरासृग्वसापङ्कचर्चितस्ते करोज्ज्वलः । शुभाय खड्गो भवतु चण्डिके त्वां नता वयम्॥
Translation: May Your Sword, smeared with the mire of asuras’ blood and fat and blazing as the sun’s rays, be for our welfare. O Caṇḍikā, we bow to You!

Verse: रोगानशेषानपहंसि तुष्टा रुष्टा तु कामान् सकलानभीष्टान् । त्वामाश्रितानां न विपन्नराणां त्वामाश्रिता ह्याश्रयतां प्रयान्ति॥
Translation: When pleased, You Destroy All Afflictions, but when Displeased, You Thwart all aspirations. No calamity befalls those who have taken refuge In You, and they who resort To You become a refuge to others.

Verse: एतत्कृतं यत्कदनं त्वयाद्य धर्मद्विषां देवि महासुराणाम् । रूपैरनेकैर्बहुधात्ममूर्तिं कृत्वाम्बिके तत्प्रकरोति कान्या॥
Translation: O Devī, Multiplying Your Own Form Into Many, You Have Wrought Destruction on the mighty asuras who hate righteousness. O Ambikā, Who Else can accomplish that?

Verse: विद्यासु शास्त्रेषु विवेकदीपेष्वाद्येषु वाक्येषु च का त्वदन्या । ममत्वगर्तेऽतिमहान्धकारे विभ्रामयत्येतदतीव विश्वम्॥
Translation: Who Other Than You Abides In All Forms of learning, In The Sacred Texts that Are Lights Of Understanding, In The Primordial Wisdom Of The Vedas? yet Who Else confounds this universe in the darkest abyss of attachment?

Verse: रक्षांसि यत्रोग्रविषाश्च नागा यत्रारयो दस्युबलानि यत्र । दावानलो यत्र तथाब्धिमध्ये तत्र स्थिता त्वं परिपासि विश्वम्॥
Translation: Where malevolent beings and venomous serpents lurk, where enemies and thieves abound, where forest conflagrations rage, there and even in mid-ocean You Stand And Protect the universe.

Verse: विश्वेश्वरि त्वं परिपासि विश्वं विश्वात्मिका धारयसीह विश्वम् । विश्वेशवन्द्या भवती भवन्ति विश्वाश्रया ये त्वयि भक्तिनम्राः॥
Translation: O Ruler Of The Universe, You Protect the universe. You Are The Essence Of all things, and You Support All that is. All kings must praise You, O Revered One, and those who bow to You in devotion become the refuge of all.

Verse: देवि प्रसीद परिपालय नोऽरिभीतेर्नित्यं यथासुरवधादधुनैव सद्यः । पापानि सर्वजगतां प्रशमं नयाशु उत्पातपाकजनितांश्च महोपसर्गान्॥
Translation: Be Gracious, O Devī. Even As You Have destroyed the asuras, protect us always from the fear of enemies. May You Subdue the evils of all the worlds and great disasters born of ominous portents.

Verse: प्रणतानां प्रसीद त्वं देवि विश्वार्तिहारिणि । त्रैलोक्यवासिनामीड्ये लोकानां वरदा भव॥
Translation: To those who bow down To You, Be Gracious, O Devī, Who Remove the afflictions of all and Who Are Worthy of praise by the dwellers of the three worlds. Confer Your Boons Upon The Worlds.’

Verse: देव्युवाच॥
Translation: The Devī Said:

Verse: वरदाहं सुरगणा वरं यन्मनसेच्छथ । तं वृणुध्वं प्रयच्छामि जगतामुपकारकम्॥
Translation: ‘O hosts of gods, I Am The Giver Of Boons. whatever blessing is your heart’s desire, choose that, and I Will Grant it for the welfare of the world.’

Verse: देवा ऊचुः॥
Translation: The gods said:

Verse: सर्वाबाधाप्रशमनं त्रैलोक्यस्याखिलेश्वरि । एवमेव त्वया कार्यमस्मद्वैरिविनाशनम्॥
Translation: ‘O Ruler of all, may You Allay all the miseries of the three worlds and so, too, annihilate our enemies.’

Verse: देव्युवाच॥
Translation: The Devī Said:

Verse: वैवस्वतेऽन्तरे प्राप्ते अष्टाविंशतिमे युगे । शुम्भो निशुम्भश्चैवान्यावुत्पत्स्येते महासुरौ॥
Translation: ‘When the twenty-eighth cycle in the age of the manu Vaivasvata has come, two other great asuras, also named Śumbha and Niśumbha, will arise.

Verse: नन्दगोपगृहे जाता यशोदागर्भसम्भवा । ततस्तौ नाशयिष्यामि विन्ध्याचलनिवासिनी॥
Translation: Then Shall I Be Born in the home of the Cowherd Nanda, brought forth From Yaśodā’s womb; and Dwelling in the Vindhya Mountains, I Shall Destroy the two asuras.

Verse: पुनरप्यतिरौद्रेण रूपेण पृथिवीतले । अवतीर्य हनिष्यामि वैप्रचित्तांश्च दानवान्॥
Translation: Again, having Incarnated on earth in a surpassingly horrific form, I Shall Slay the demons descended from Vipracitti.

Verse: भक्षयन्त्याश्च तानुग्रान् वैप्रचित्तान् महासुरान् । रक्ता दन्ता भविष्यन्ति दाडिमीकुसुमोपमाः॥
Translation: Upon Devouring those fierce asuras, My Teeth Will Become Red Like Pomegranate flowers.

Verse: ततो मां देवताः स्वर्गे मर्त्यलोके च मानवाः । स्तुवन्तो व्याहरिष्यन्ति सततं रक्तदन्तिकाम्॥
Translation: Thereafter, In Praise Of Me, The Gods in heaven and the humans in the mortal realm Will Forever Call Me Raktadantikā.

Verse: भूयश्च शतवार्षिक्यामनावृष्ट्यामनम्भसि । मुनिभिः संस्मृता भूमौ सम्भविष्याम्ययोनिजा॥
Translation: Again, when no rain has fallen for a hundred years and there is no water on earth, Then Praised by sages, I Shall Appear, But Not Born Of A Womb.

Verse: ततः शतेन नेत्राणां निरीक्षिष्याम्यहं मुनीन् । कीर्तयिष्यन्ति मनुजाः शताक्षीमिति मां ततः॥
Translation: since I Shall Behold the Sages With A Hundred Eyes, humankind Will Glorify Me As Śatāksī.

Verse: ततोऽहमखिलं लोकमात्मदेहसमुद्भवैः । भरिष्यामि सुराः शाकैरावृष्टेः प्राणधारकैः॥
Translation: Causing the rains to fall, O gods, I Shall Support The Entire World With Life-Sustaining Vegetables Brought Forth From My Own Substance.

Verse: शाकम्भरीति विख्यातिं तदा यास्याम्यहं भुवि । तत्रैव च वधिष्यामि दुर्गमाख्यं महासुरम्॥
Translation: Thus Shall I Be Celebrated On Earth As Śākambharī,

Verse: दुर्गादेवीति विख्यातं तन्मे नाम भविष्यति । पुनश्चाहं यदा भीमं रूपं कृत्वा हिमाचले॥
Translation: and then also shall I Slay a great asura called Durgama and thus come to be Celebrated As The Devī Durgā.

Verse: रक्षांसि भक्षयिष्यामि मुनीनां त्राणकारणात् । तदा मां मुनयः सर्वे स्तोष्यन्त्यानम्रमूर्तयः॥
Translation: again, when I Have Assumed A Terrible form in the Himālayas, I Shall Destroy malevolent beings for the protection of the Sages.

Verse: भीमादेवीति विख्यातं तन्मे नाम भविष्यति । यदारुणाख्यस्त्रैलोक्ये महाबाधां करिष्यति॥
Translation: Then all the Sages, with bodies bowed, will Praise Me. Thus shall I come to be celebrated by the name of Bhīmadevī.

Verse: तदाहं भ्रामरं रूपं कृत्वासङ्ख्येयषट्पदम् । त्रैलोक्यस्य हितार्थाय वधिष्यामि महासुरम्॥
Translation: When a demon called Aruṇa wreaks great havoc in the three worlds, then shall I assume form as a Swarm Of Countless Bees

Verse: भ्रामरीति च मां लोकास्तदा स्तोष्यन्ति सर्वतः । इत्थं यदा यदा बाधा दानवोत्था भविष्यति॥
Translation: and Slay the great asura for the welfare of the three worlds. Thus will people everywhere extol Me as Bhrāmarī.

Verse: तदा तदावतीर्याहं करिष्याम्यरिसङ्क्षयम्॥
Translation: And so, whenever danger arises from demonic sources, I shall Descend and bring about the complete destruction of enemies.’”

Verse: ॐ देव्युवाच॥
Translation: The Devī said:

Verse: एभिः स्तवैश्च मां नित्यं स्तोष्यते यः समाहितः । तस्याहं सकलां बाधां शमयिष्याम्यसंशयम्॥
Translation: “I shall without doubt destroy every misfortune of those who with collected mind will praise Me always with these hymns.

Verse: मधुकैटभनाशं च महिषासुरघातनम् । कीर्तयिष्यन्ति ये तद्वद्वधं शुम्भनिशुम्भयोः॥
Translation: Those who recite the destruction of Madhu and Kaiṭabha, the killing of Mahiṣāsura, and the slaying of Śumbha and Niśumbha

Verse: अष्टम्यां च चतुर्दश्यां नवम्यां चैकचेतसः । श्रोष्यन्ति चैव ये भक्त्या मम माहात्म्यमुत्तमम्॥
Translation: with singleness of mind on the eighth, fourteenth, and ninth days of the lunar fortnight, and those who listen with devotion to this supreme poem of My glory

Verse: न तेषां दुष्कृतं किञ्चिद्दुष्कृतोत्था न चापदः । भविष्यति न दारिद्र्यं न चैवेष्टवियोजनम्॥
Translation: will have no evil befall them, nor any misfortunes arising from wrongdoing. For them there will be neither poverty nor separation from loved ones,

Verse: शत्रुभ्यो न भयं तस्य दस्युतो वा न राजतः । न शस्त्रानलतोयौघात् कदाचित् सम्भविष्यति॥
Translation: nor danger from enemies, robbers, or kings. Nor at any time will danger arise from weapons, fire, or flood.

Verse: तस्मान्ममैतन्माहात्म्यं पठितव्यं समाहितैः । श्रोतव्यं च सदा भक्त्या परं स्वस्त्ययनं महत्॥
Translation: Therefore this poem of My glory is to be recited by those of concentrated mind and heard always with devotion, for it is the supreme way to well-being.

Verse: उपसर्गानशेषांस्तु महामारीसमुद्भवान् । तथा त्रिविधमुत्पातं माहात्म्यं शमयेन्मम॥
Translation: May this glorification of Mine put to rest all misfortunes born of pestilence, and also the three kinds of calamity.

Verse: यत्रैतत्पठ्यते सम्यङ्नित्यमायतने मम । सदा न तद्विमोक्ष्यामि सान्निध्यं तत्र मे स्थितम्॥
Translation: Where it is always and rightly recited in My sanctuary, that place shall I never abandon. There My presence is abiding.

Verse: बलिप्रदाने पूजायामग्निकार्ये महोत्सवे । सर्वं ममैतन्माहात्म्यम् उच्चार्यं श्राव्यमेव च॥
Translation: In the offering of oblations, in worship, in the fire ceremony, and in the great festival, all these deeds of Mine are to be proclaimed and heard.

Verse: जानताजानता वापि बलिपूजां यथा कृताम् । प्रतीक्षिष्याम्यहं प्रीत्या वह्निहोमं तथाकृतम्॥
Translation: When offerings are made in worship, with or without proper knowledge, I shall receive them gladly and also the fire oblation performed in like manner.

Verse: शरत्काले महापूजा क्रियते या च वार्षिकी । तस्यां ममैतन्माहात्म्यं श्रुत्वा भक्तिसमन्वितः॥
Translation: At the great annual worship which is performed in the autumn season, those who hear this poem of My glory and are filled with devotion

Verse: सर्वाबाधाविनिर्मुक्तो धनधान्यसमन्वितः । मनुष्यो मत्प्रसादेन भविष्यति न संशयः॥
Translation: will be freed by My grace from all afflictions and endowed with wealth, grain, and progeny. Of this there is no doubt.

Verse: श्रुत्वा ममैतन्माहात्म्यं तथा चोत्पत्तयः शुभाः । पराक्रमं च युद्धेषु जायते निर्भयः पुमान्॥
Translation: Hearing of My glory, My auspicious manifestations, and My prowess in battles, they become fearless.

Verse: रिपवः सङ्क्षयं यान्ति कल्याणं चोपपद्यते । नन्दते च कुलं पुंसां माहात्म्यं मम शृण्वताम्॥
Translation: For those who hear My glorification, their adversaries go to utter destruction. Well-being comes to them, and their families rejoice.

Verse: शान्तिकर्मणि सर्वत्र तथा दुःस्वप्नदर्शने । ग्रहपीडासु चोग्रासु माहात्म्यं शृणुयान्मम॥
Translation: For those troubled by nightmares or the ill-boding of stars, at rituals for averting evil this poem of My glory should always be heard.

Verse: उपसर्गाः शमं यान्ति ग्रहपीडाश्च दारुणाः । दुःस्वप्नं च नृभिर्दृष्टं सुस्वप्नमुपजायते॥
Translation: It causes misfortunes and evil portents to subside, and it turns nightmares into sweet dreams.

Verse: बालग्रहाभिभूतानां बालानां शान्तिकारकम् । सङ्घातभेदे च नृणां मैत्रीकरणमुत्तमम्॥
Translation: It pacifies children overcome by seizures, and wherever discord divides, it best restores friendship.

Verse: दुर्वृत्तानामशेषाणां बलहानिकरं परम् । रक्षोभूतपिशाचानां पठनादेव नाशनम्॥
Translation: It is unsurpassed in diminishing the might of all evildoers. Truly its recitation brings about the destruction of fiends, ghosts, and ghouls.

Verse: सर्वं ममैतन्माहात्म्यं मम सन्निधिकारकम् । पशुपुष्पार्घ्यधूपैश्च गन्धदीपैस्तथोत्तमैः॥
Translation: This entire glorification of mine draws one near to Me.

Verse: विप्राणां भोजनैर्होमैः प्रोक्षणीयैरहर्निशम् । अन्यैश्च विविधैर्भोगैः प्रदानैर्वत्सरेण या॥
Translation: As by the offerings of finest cattle, flowers, gifts, incense, perfumes, and lights, made day and night for a year; and as by the feeding of Brāhmaṇas, by oblations, by consecrated water;

Verse: प्रीतिर्मे क्रियते सास्मिन् सकृदुच्चरिते श्रुते । श्रुतं हरति पापानि तथारोग्यं प्रयच्छति॥
Translation: and as by diverse other propitiations and offerings; so also by hearing the recital of My auspicious deeds am I pleased.

Verse: रक्षां करोति भूतेभ्यो जन्मनां कीर्तनं मम । युद्धेषु चरितं यन्मे दुष्टदैत्यनिबर्हणम्॥
Translation: When heard, this poem of My glory removes impurities and grants freedom from disease. The relating of My births confers protection from evil spirits.

Verse: तस्मिञ्छ्रुते वैरिकृतं भयं पुंसां न जायते । युष्माभिः स्तुतयो याश्च याश्च ब्रह्मर्षिभिः कृताः॥
Translation: Since it recounts My deeds in battle, crushing the wicked daityas, when heard, it dispels all fear of enemies.

Verse: ब्रह्मणा च कृतास्तास्तु प्रयच्छन्तु शुभां मतिम् । अरण्ये प्रान्तरे वापि दावाग्निपरिवारितः॥
Translation: Praises uttered by you and the Brāhmanical seers and by Brahmā himself produce an auspicious mind.

Verse: दस्युभिर्वा वृतः शून्ये गृहीतो वापि शत्रुभिः । सिंहव्याघ्रानुयातो वा वने वा वनहस्तिभिः॥
Translation: When in a forest, or on a lonely road, or surrounded by a forest fire, when encircled by robbers in a desolate place or seized by enemies,

Verse: राज्ञा क्रुद्धेन चाज्ञप्तो वध्यो बन्धगतोऽपि वा । आघूर्णितो वा वातेन स्थितः पोते महार्णवे॥
Translation: when stalked by lions and tigers or wild elephants in the jungle, when imprisoned or sentenced to death by a wrathful king,

Verse: पतत्सु चापि शस्त्रेषु सङ्ग्रामे भृशदारुणे । सर्वाबाधासु घोरासु वेदनाभ्यर्दितोऽपि वा॥
Translation: when in a wind-tossed boat on the mighty sea or assailed by hurtling weapons in the midst of battle,

Verse: स्मरन् ममैतच्चरितं नरो मुच्येत सङ्कटात् । मम प्रभावात्सिंहाद्या दस्यवो वैरिणस्तथा॥
Translation: when caught in dreadful straits or tormented with agony, whoever remembers these deeds of Mine is freed from danger.

Verse: दूरादेव पलायन्ते स्मरतश्चरितं मम॥
Translation: By My power, lions and beasts, robbers and enemies flee far away from one who remembers these deeds of mine.”

Verse: ऋषिरुवाच॥
Translation: The seer said:

Verse: इत्युक्त्वा सा भगवती चण्डिका चण्डविक्रमा॥
Translation: “Having spoken thus, the blessed Caṇḍikā, fierce in valor, vanished from the sight of the gods.

Verse: पश्यतां सर्वदेवानां तत्रैवान्तरधीयत । तेऽपि देवा निरातङ्काः स्वाधिकारान्यथा पुरा॥
Translation: Their enemies struck down, the gods were delivered from affliction. They reclaimed their own dominions as before, and all partook of their shares in the sacrifices.

Verse: यज्ञभागभुजः सर्वे चक्रुर्विनिहतारयः । दैत्याश्च देव्या निहते शुम्भे देवरिपौ युधि॥
Translation: As for the daityas, after the Devī had slain in battle those two enemies of the gods— Śumbha, the afflictor of the world, terribly fierce and unequaled in prowess,

Verse: जगद्विध्वंसके तस्मिन् महोग्रेऽतुलविक्रमे । निशुम्भे च महावीर्ये शेषाः पातालमाययुः॥
Translation: and Niśumbha, great in valor—the rest of them returned to the netherworld.

Verse: एवं भगवती देवी सा नित्यापि पुनः पुनः । सम्भूय कुरुते भूप जगतः परिपालनम्॥
Translation: Thus, O king, does the blessed Devī, though eternal, manifest again and again for the protection of the world.

Verse: तयैतन्मोह्यते विश्वं सैव विश्वं प्रसूयते । सा याचिता च विज्ञानं तुष्टा ऋद्धिं प्रयच्छति॥
Translation: By Her this universe is deluded. She Herself brings forth everything. Entreated, She bestows right knowledge; propitiated, She bestows prosperity.

Verse: व्याप्तं तयैतत्सकलं ब्रह्माण्डं मनुजेश्वर । महादेव्या महाकाली महामारीस्वरूपया॥
Translation: O king, by Her all this universe is pervaded, by Mahākālī, who takes form as the great destroyer at the end of time.

Verse: सैव काले महामारी सैव सृष्टिर्भवत्यजा । स्थितिं करोति भूतानां सैव काले सनातनी॥
Translation: At that time, She herself is the great destroyer. Existing from all eternity, She herself becomes the creation. She, the eternal one, sustains all beings.

Verse: भवकाले नृणां सैव लक्ष्मीर्वृद्धिप्रदा गृहे । सैवाभावे तथालक्ष्मीर्विनाशायोपजायते॥
Translation: In times of well-being She is indeed good fortune, granting prosperity in the homes of humankind. In times of privation, She exists as misfortune, bringing about ruin.

Verse: स्तुता सम्पूजिता पुष्पैर्गन्धधूपादिभिस्तथा । ददाति वित्तं पुत्रांश्च मतिं धर्मे गतिं शुभाम्॥
Translation: And so, praised and worshiped with flowers, incense, perfumes, and the like, She grants wealth, progeny, and a pure mind established in righteousness.”

Verse: ॐ ऋषिरुवाच॥
Translation: The seer said:

Verse: एतत्ते कथितं भूप देवीमाहात्म्यमुत्तमम् । एवं प्रभावा सा देवी ययेदं धार्यते जगत्॥
Translation: “Thus have I related to you, O king, this supreme glorification of the Devī:

Verse: विद्या तथैव क्रियते भगवद्विष्णुमायया । तया त्वमेष वैश्यश्च तथैवान्ये विवेकिनः॥
Translation: Such is the splendor of the Devī, by whom the world is upheld, and such is the knowledge fashioned by the blessed Viṣṇumāyā.

Verse: मोह्यन्ते मोहिताश्चैव मोहमेष्यन्ति चापरे । तामुपैहि महाराज शरणं परमेश्वरीम्॥
Translation: By Her are you and this merchant and other thoughtful people deluded, just as others have been and will be deluded.

Verse: आराधिता सैव नृणां भोगस्वर्गापवर्गदा॥
Translation: O great king, take refuge in Her, the Supreme Sovereign. When worshiped, She truly confers enjoyment, heaven, and final liberation on humanity.”

Verse: मार्कण्डेय उवाच॥
Translation: Mārkaṇḍeya said:

Verse: इति तस्य वचः श्रुत्वा सुरथः स नराधिपः॥
Translation: Hearing his words, Suratha the king bowed in reverence to the illustrious seer of steadfast austerities.

Verse: प्रणिपत्य महाभागं तमृषिं संशितव्रतम् । निर्विण्णोऽतिममत्वेन राज्यापहरणेन च॥
Translation: Despondent over excessive attachment and the loss of his kingdom, he went at once to practice austerities, O great sage, and so did the merchant,

Verse: जगाम सद्यस्तपसे स च वैश्यो महामुने । सन्दर्शनार्थमम्बाया नदीपुलिनमास्थितः॥
Translation: that they might obtain a vision of the Mother. The king and the merchant settled on a riverbank and engaged in spiritual practice, chanting the supreme hymn to the Devī.

Verse: स च वैश्यस्तपस्तेपे देवीसूक्तं परं जपन् । तौ तस्मिन् पुलिने देव्याः कृत्वा मूर्तिं महीमयीम्॥
Translation: When they had fashioned an earthen image Of Her on the riverbank, the two of them worshiped The Devī with flowers, incense, fire, and libations of water.

Verse: अर्हणां चक्रतुस्तस्याः पुष्पधूपाग्नितर्पणैः । निराहारौ यतात्मानौ तन्मनस्कौ समाहितौ॥
Translation: Now fasting, now restraining their senses, with minds constant in concentration, they made offerings sprinkled with the blood of their own bodies.

Verse: ददतुस्तौ बलिं चैव निजगात्रासृगुक्षितम् । एवं समाराधयतोस्त्रिभिर्वर्षैर्यतात्मनोः॥
Translation: When they had worshiped Her in this way with self- restraint for three years, Caṇḍikā, The Support Of The Universe, Was Well Pleased. She Appeared Before Them And Spoke.

Verse: परितुष्टा जगद्धात्री प्रत्यक्षं प्राह चण्डिका॥
Translation: The Devī Said:

Verse: देव्युवाच॥
Translation: “That which you desire, O king, and you, the delight of your family,

Verse: यत्प्रार्थ्यते त्वया भूप त्वया च कुलनन्दन । मत्तस्तत्प्राप्यतां सर्वं परितुष्टा ददामिते॥
Translation: receive all that from Me. Well pleased, I will grant it.”

Verse: मार्कण्डेय उवाच॥
Translation: Mārkaṇḍeya said:

Verse: ततो वव्रे नृपो राज्यमविभ्रंश्यन्यजन्मनि । अत्रैव च निजं राज्यं हतशत्रुबलं बलात्॥
Translation: Thereupon the king chose a kingdom imperishable even in another lifetime and also his own kingdom here, to be reclaimed by force from his enemies’ control.

Verse: सोऽपि वैश्यस्ततो ज्ञानं वव्रे निर्विण्णमानसः । ममेत्यहमिति प्राज्ञः सङ्गविच्युतिकारकम्॥
Translation: And then the wise merchant, dispassionate in mind, chose that knowledge which severs attachment from “I” and “mine.”

Verse: देव्युवाच॥
Translation: The Devī Said:

Verse: स्वल्पैरहोभिर्नृपते स्वं राज्यं प्राप्स्यते भवान्॥
Translation: “In a few days, O king, you will reclaim your own kingdom.

Verse: हत्वा रिपूनस्खलितं तव तत्र भविष्यति॥
Translation: When your enemies are slain, thenceforth it will assuredly be yours.

Verse: मृतश्च भूयः सम्प्राप्य जन्म देवाद्विवस्वतः॥
Translation: And after your death you will obtain another birth from the sun god Vivasvat.

Verse: सावर्णिको मनुर्नाम भवान्भुवि भविष्यति॥
Translation: Dwelling on earth, you will become the lord of the age, the manu named Sāvarṇi.

Verse: वैश्यवर्य त्वया यश्च वरोऽस्मत्तोऽभिवाञ्छितः॥
Translation: And the boon that you, O best of merchants, desire,

Verse: तं प्रयच्छामि संसिद्ध्यै तव ज्ञानं भविष्यति॥
Translation: that do I grant you. The knowledge that leads to final liberation shall be yours.”

Verse: मार्कण्डेय उवाच॥
Translation: Mārkaṇḍeya said:

Verse: इति दत्त्वा तयोर्देवी यथाभिलषितं वरम्॥
Translation: When She had given each his desired boon, The Devī, lovingly praised by both of them, vanished at once.

Verse: बभूवान्तर्हिता सद्यो भक्त्या ताभ्यामभिष्टुता । एवं देव्या वरं लब्ध्वा सुरथः क्षत्रियर्षभः॥
Translation: Thus, having received The Devī’s Boon, Suratha, the best of sovereigns will obtain birth from the sun god and will become the manu named Sāvarṇi,

Verse: सूर्याज्जन्म समासाद्य सावर्णिर्भविता मनुः॥
Translation: will become the manu named Sāvarṇi. Klīm OṀ.
